column4: hi, i think i completely screwed up my pc via grub anybody care to help me out?
ive got a 2 sata2 harddrive setup. hda had vista and hdb was supposed to be the ubuntu one. after i made the partitions in hdb i installed grub in the mbr of hda (hd0)
after the 1st boot grub hungs with an error 22 and after  couple of tried with error 17
what i did was to change the sata2 cables and make hda hdb and vise versa
installed again and all is ok for ubuntu
but the mbr of hdb (now containing vista)
can i restore vista mbr in hdb ? and if i do that will vista load ok after i manualy changed its mapping?
i have it but i cant load recovery console cause it doesnt recognise my password
put the HDD's back the way they were, fix mbr, then reinstall grub
i cant cause i found out that the grub problem i had was because i didnt install grub in the linux mbr
it just hungs if i use that setup
does this make any sense? grub asking for my primary hd to be a linux native?
